Title: Statement following the EU-US Justice and Home Affairs ministerial meeting
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union and the United States of America exchanged views on action to jointly counter the misuse of the internet for terrorist purposes, in cooperation with multiple stakeholders, including the private sector and civil society. The European Union provided updates regarding increased efforts to counter the use of the internet for terrorist purposes under the umbrella of the EU Internet Forum. The European Union and the United States of America agreed on the need to jointly address cybersecurity and counter cybercrime and in this context took note of the conclusions of the 14 November 2017 EU-US Cyber Dialogue

Title: Deepening EU security cooperation with Asian partners: Council adopts conclusions
Short Description / inclusion criteria: On 28 May 2018, the Council adopted conclusions on enhanced EU security cooperation in and with Asia.The Council notes that there are important possibilities to deepen EU security cooperation with its Asian strategic partners: China, India, Japan and the Republic of Korea, as well as with other partners, along with ASEAN and its member states.The Council identifies key areas for deeper security engagement: maritime security, cyber security, counter terrorism, hybrid threats, conflict prevention, the proliferation of chemical biological radiological and nuclear weapons and the development of regional cooperative orders.
Region/Organization: China, India, Japan, Republic of Korea, other ASEAN states

Title: Joint statement by Presidents Tusk and Juncker and High Representative Mogherini on Russian cyber attacks
linked CI: The Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) in The Hague were targeted by a  cyber operation carried out by the Russian military intelligence service (GRU) in April 2018
Short Description / inclusion criteria: EU Council: "We express serious concerns about this attempt to undermine the integrity of the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW), a respected international organisation, hosted by the Netherlands. This aggressive act demonstrated contempt for the solemn purpose of the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW), which works to eradicate weapons worldwide under a United Nations mandate. The EU will continue to strengthen the resilience of its institutions and those of its Member States, and international partners and organisations in the digital domain."

Title: European Council conclusions on the MFF, climate change, disinformation and hybrid threats, external relations, enlargement and the European Semester, 20 June 2019
Short Description / inclusion criteria: European Council: "The EU must ensure a coordinated response to hybrid and cyber threats and strengthen its cooperation with relevant international actors. The European Council welcomes the adoption of a new framework for targeted restrictive measures, and the work on coordinated attribution at EU level in the context of the cyber diplomacy toolbox, to better deter and respond to cyber-attacks. It invites the EU institutions, together with the Member States, to work on measures to enhance the resilience and improve the security culture of the EU against cyber and hybrid threats from outside the EU, and to better protect the EU's information and communication networks, and its decision-making processes, from malicious activities of all kinds."

Title: EU Statement – United Nations Open-Ended Working Group on ICT: Cyber Threats
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union delivered a statement at the United Nations Open-Ended Working Group on ICT Cyber Threats. The EU once again emphasized the need for a comprehensive and coordinated approach to address cyber threats. It called for increased international cooperation, information sharing, and capacity building to strengthen cybersecurity and protect critical infrastructure.

Title: EU Statement – United Nations Open-Ended Working Group on ICT: International Law
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union delivered a statement at the United Nations Open-Ended Working Group on ICT Security. The EU emphasized the importance of promoting a secure and stable cyberspace through international cooperation and the application of international law. It highlighted the need for comprehensive strategies to address cyber threats and protect critical infrastructure.

Title: EU Statement – United Nations Open-Ended Working Group on ICT: Rules, norms and principles
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union delivered a statement at the United Nations Open-Ended Working Group on ICT Rules, Norms, and Principles. The EU underlined the significance of rules, norms, and principles in ensuring responsible behavior of states in cyberspace. It also emphasized the need for international  mutual consensus on these norms to promote stability, security, and cooperation in the digital domain.

Title: EU Statement – United Nations Open-Ended Working Group on ICT: Capacity-building
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union delivered a statement at the United Nations Open-Ended Working Group on ICT Capacity Building. The EU highlighted the significance of capacity building in information and communication technologies (ICT).

Title: Open-Ended Working Group on ICT: Institutional dialogue with the broad participation of States
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The EU emphasizes the need for a comprehensive approach to address thee challenges of information and communication technologies, including promoting human rights, cybersecurity, digital trust, and international cooperation.

Short Description / inclusion criteria: Capacity building in the Western Balkan states

Title: Initiative for digital government and cybersecurity
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Capacity building at the Horn of Africa

Title: Ukraine: Declaration by the High Representative on behalf of the European Union on the cyberattack against Ukraine
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union strongly condemns the cyberattack against Ukraine on 14 January and stand ready to provide additional, direct, technical assistance to Ukraine to remediate this attack and further support Ukraine against any destabilizing actions, including by further building up its resilience against hybrid and cyber threats

Title: Speech by Vice-President Šefčovič on behalf of President von der Leyen at the European Parliament on the presentation of the programme of the French Presidency
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Strenghting peaceful democratic governance from cyber threats e.g. border of Belarus

Title: EU Statement – UN General Assembly: the Secretary-General’s Priorities for 2022
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union delivered a statement on the Secretary-General's priorities for the year 2022 at the UN General Assembly. The EU expressed its support for the Secretary-General's focus on key areas, including climate action, sustainable development, human rights, peace and security, and global health. It also  emphasized the importance of collective efforts in addressing global challenges.

Title: European Parliament delegation ends visit to Ukraine
Short Description / inclusion criteria: A high-level delegation of the European Parliament, which travelled to Ukraine amid the current security crisis, concluded its visit on Tuesday.

Short Description / inclusion criteria: During a press conference with Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal, European Commission Executive Vice President Dombrovskis highlighted the EU's commitment to supporting Ukraine. He emphasized the importance of economic and political reforms in Ukraine and reiterated the EU's assistance in promoting - inter alia -  stability, prosperity, and European integration.

Title: EU Statement - UN General Assembly: situation in Ukraine
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The EU condemns Russia's aggression against Ukraine, demands an immediate end to military actions, withdrawal of Russian troops, and respect for Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty, and international law.

Title: EU Statement – UN General Assembly: Our Common Agenda, Frameworks for a peaceful world
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union delivered a statement at the UN General Assembly on the "Our Common Agenda" initiative. The EU highlighted the significance of cybersecurity and digitalization in shaping the future. It stressed the need for global cooperation to address the challenges and threats arising from cyberspace. The EU called for the development of comprehensive and inclusive frameworks for the cyber domain.,

Title: EU Statement - UN General Assembly: 11th Emergency Special Session (Ukraine)

Title: Assistance Measure to support Ukrainian Armed Forces - Cyber Defence Component
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The overall objective of this Action is to enhance the overall resilience of Ukraine and help strengthen the capacities of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, their ability to provide their services to civilians in crises or emergency situations, in particular providing support on cybersecurity

Title: Statement at the High Level Segment of Conference on Disarmament
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The EU emphasizes the importance of disarmament and arms control, urging all states to fulfill their commitments and work towards a safer and more secure world.

Title: EU Statement – UN Ad-hoc Committee for a UN Convention on Cybercrime: General Debate
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union delivered a statement at the UN Ad Hoc Committee on the UN Convention on Cybercrime General Debate. The EU highlighted the importance of international cooperation in combating cybercrime and promoting effective legal frameworks. It emphasized the need for comprehensive legislation and international cooperation. The EU also expressed its support for the UN Convention on Cybercrime.

Title: EU Statement – UN Ad-hoc Committee for a UN Convention on Cybercrime: Objectives and scope of the Convention
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The EU outlines its objectives and priorities in addressing cybercrime, stressing the need for international cooperation and the protection of human rights in combating this global challenge.

Short Description / inclusion criteria: The EU provides an update on the latest developments in the UNECE region, highlighting key achievements, challenges, and ongoing efforts in various areas of cooperation.

Short Description / inclusion criteria: The EU emphasizes the importance of the cessation of the arms race and nuclear disarmament, highlighting the need for concrete actions and compliance with international obligations.

Title: G7 Leaders’ Statement
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The G7 Leaders issued a statement expressing their concern over malicious cyber activities conducted by state and non-state actors. They emphasized the need for a rules-based international order in cyberspace and called for enhanced cooperation to address cyber threats. The G7 Leaders reaffirmed their commitment to international norms and principles of responsible state behavior in cyberspace (includ. the applicability of international law) They pledged to work together to strengthen cybersecurity and to especially protect critical infrastructure.

Title: EU Statement – UN Open-Ended Working Group on ICT: Organisation of Work
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union addressed the issue of ICT threats and initiatives during its statement at the UN Open-Ended Working Group. It acknowledged the evolving landscape of cyber threats and emphasized the importance of collective action to mitigate risks. The EU called for enhanced cooperation, information sharing, and capacity building to address emerging threats. It also highlighted the need for international norms and rules to guide responsible state behavior in cyberspace.

Title: EU Statement – UN Open-Ended Working Group on ICT: Threats and Initiatives of States aimed at ensuring security in the use of ICTs
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union addresses the issue of ICT threats and initiatives during its statement at the UN Open-Ended Working Group, calling for enhanced cooperation, information sharing, and capacity building to mitigate emerging cyber threats.

Title: Conference on Disarmament, EU Statement in Subsidiary Body 5
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union delivers a statement at the Conference on Disarmament's Subsidiary Body 5, expressing concern over Russia's aggression against Ukraine and calling for immediate cessation of military actions, withdrawal of Russian forces, and respect for Ukraine's territorial integrity and sovereignty.

Title: EU Statement – UN Open-Ended Working Group on ICT: International Law
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union emphasized the importance of upholding international law in the context of ICT during its statement at the UN Open-ended Working Group. It highlighted the role of international law, capacity building, and cooperative approaches in shaping a secure and stable cyberspace. The EU expressed its commitment to contributing to discussions and fostering a rules-based cyberspace.

Title: EU Statement – UN Open-Ended Working Group on ICT: Rules, norms and principles of responsible behaviour of States
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union highlighted the importance of established rules, norms, and principles of responsible behavior in cyberspace during its statement at the UN Open-Ended Working Group. It also underlined the need to enhance our common understanding, implement these principles, and exchange best practices. The EU also expressed its readiness to share its experience and collaborate with other states and stakeholders to strengthen capacity building efforts effectively and ensure security and stability in cyberspace.

Title: EU Statement – UN Open-Ended Working Group on ICT: Capacity-building
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The EU reaffirmed its commitment to supporting capacity building efforts in the field of information and communication technologies (ICT) within the framework of the UN Open-ended Working Group.

Short Description / inclusion criteria: Cooperation with Western Balkans, Eastern Partnership and European Southern Neighbourhood
Region/Organization: Western Balkans, Eastern Partnership and Southern Neighbourhood

Title: The EU must act and step up its support to Moldova following the Ukraine war
Short Description / inclusion criteria: A European Parliament delegation, which travelled to the Republic of Moldova against the backdrop of a worsening security situation in Europe, finalised its visit on Saturday..MEPs discussed with the Moldovan Parliament the follow-up to the Memorandum of Understanding between the two institutions and announced that the European Parliament’s Democracy Support Group would visit. The objective will be to assess possible enhanced parliamentary democracy support measures, including in the areas of information security, tackling cyberattacks and disinformation and strengthening overall capacities and resilience of the Moldovan Parliament.

Title: EU General Statement: Consultations on a Draft Political Declaration on Strengthening the Protection of Civilians from the Humanitarian Consequences arising from the use of Explosive Weapons in Populated Areas

Short Description / inclusion criteria: The Council approved conclusions on developing the Union’s cyber posture. They highlighted the need for stronger international cooperation to address these challenges and emphasized the importance of upholding international law and norms in the cyberspace. The EU called for enhancing cybersecurity measures, promoting responsible state behavior, and fostering dialogue and confidence-building among OSCE participating States.

Short Description / inclusion criteria: The EU and its member states are concerned about the evolving ICT threat landscape, including ransomware and "wiper" attacks. Lessons from Ukraine's experience are valuable, and they seek timely information and support from the OEWG.

Title: EU Statement – UN General Assembly Open-Ended Working Group on ICTs: Confidence Building Measures
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The European Union (EU) and its member states express support for confidence building measures (CBMs) in the use of information and communications technologies, emphasizing the relevance of CBMs in defusing conflicts and preventing escalation, particularly in light of Russia's aggression against Ukraine, and suggest learning from regional organisations' experiences and incorporating them into UN deliberations, while also promoting cross-regional CBM cooperation and joint implementation initiatives.

Title: EU Statement – UN Open-Ended Working Group on ICT: International Law

Title: Cyber defence: Council conclusions stress the importance of further strengthening the EU’s resilience to cyber threats

Against this background, the Council today approved conclusions on cyber defence, stressing the need for the EU and its member states to further strengthen their resilience to cyber threats and enhance its common cyber security and cyber defence against malicious behaviour and acts of aggression in cyberspace."

Title: EU-U.S.: Consultations between European External Action Service Secretary General Stefano Sannino and U.S. Under Secretary of State Victoria Nuland
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Secretary Sannino and Under Secretary Nuland stressed the importance of increasing coordination on cyber cooperation with the Indo-Pacific region. They intend to foster joint actions in the Indo-Pacific by supporting cyber capacity-building and CBMs.

Title: EU-NATO Task Force: Final assessment report on strengthening our resilience and protection of critical infrastructure
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The EU-NATO Task Force report stresses the new hybrid threats brought by Russias war of aggression against Ukraine. Awareness raising on vulnerability of transportion infrastructure. The recommendation is strengthening the Structured Dialogue on Resilience.

Title: Speech by Commissioner Breton on cybersecurity at the High-Level Conference on Cybersecurity in the Republic of Korea
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Awareness raising on Cybersecurity regarding the amount of recorded malware attacks in the world. The EU expresses that its ready to join forces with the Republic of Korea to enhance cyber resilience, launch a dedicated EU-Korea cyber dialogue and establish the foundations of cooperation in capacity-building exercises.

Title: EU-Latin America and Caribbean: Joint Declaration on a Digital Alliance
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Agreement on deepening the partnership by establishing an EU-LAC Digital Alliance, a Forum that provides bi-regional dialogue and cooperation on digital matters.

Title: Keynote speech by President von der Leye at the Philippines Business Forum
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The EU is deepening the security partnership and cyber cooperation with the Philippines

Title: Tech and Geopolitics: Building European Resilience in the Digital Age - Keynote speech by European Commissioner Thierry Breton at the Tallin Digital Summit
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Awareness raising on Cyberthreats in the EU due to EU being a growing target for cyberattacks

Title: Keynote introductory speech by Commissioner Simson at ENTSO-E's High-Level Forum on the 'Future of our grids: accelerating Europe's energy transition'
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Calls for cybe-proof electricity grids in the EU

Title: Ahead of Granada Summit, Commission takes stock of achievements and identifies areas for action to build a more resilient, competetive and sustainable Europe
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Stresses the need for more efforts to strengthen the European defence and adress cyber and hybrid threats

Title: Ukraine: Press remarks by High Representative Josep Borell on Russia's information manipulation in ist military aggression
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Signals the seriousness of hybrid attacks executed by Russia (propaganda, manipulation, disinformation and cyberattacks). The EU sets the fight on the hybrid war as a high priority for the EU and Ukraine.

Title: EU Statement - UN General Assembly 1st Committee: General Debate
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Cyber threatsa as a crisis the whole world has to face. Calls for a "New Agenda for Peace" which should strengthen multilateral cooperation to continue putting cyber-related risks in full compliance with international law. The EU fully supports the evolving framework of responsilbe state behavior in cyberspace.

Title: Mr Olivér Várhelyi addresses the participants of the Western Balkans Digital Summit 2023 in Sarajevo, via video message
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Stress the need to step up the efforts on strengthening the region's cyber resilience for a succssesful digital transition

Title: Third European Defence & Security Conference - Opening speech by Commission Thierry Breton
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Proposals on protection of the EU Cyberspace with a "cyber shield", a European infrastructure for the advanced deflection of cyberattacks.

Title: EU-GCC Joint Council and Ministerial Meeting: Press remarks by High Representative Josep Borrell at the joint press conference with GCC Secretary General, Jassem Al Budaiwi and Omani Minister of Foreign Affairs, Sayyid Al Busaidi
Short Description / inclusion criteria: States that the EU is open for a strategic partnership with the Golf Council Cooperation to face cyber threats

Title: U.S. - EU Summit Joint Statement
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Commitment to work together on decreasing vulnerability to cyberattacks and raise the security standards for consumer products.

Title: EU Statement - UN General Assembly 1st Committee: Cybersecurity
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Stresses the spill over effect of cyber-attacks against Ukraine on the EU countries. Underlines the need to further strengthen security and stability in cyberspace, to promote peace and security in cyberspace through a permanent and cooperative platform.

Title: OSCE Forum for Security Cooperation N°1060 Vienna, 25 October 2023
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Stresses the impact of cyber and hybrid threats on Ukraine. Reasures the support of Ukraine in fighting the hybrid threats and reinforces the comprehensive cooperation with Ukraine in its cyber defence capacity.

Title: EU-supported live fire cybersecurity exercise hoste by Moldova's Ministry of Defence
Short Description / inclusion criteria: EU supported cybersecurity exercise to enhance the cyber defence skills in Moldova

Title: Commission endorses Romania's €28.5 billion modified recovery and resilience plan, including a REPowerEU chapte
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Financially contribution to the digital transition of Romania to limit the risk of cyber attacks.

Title: EU cybersecurity exercise to foster cooperation and promote free and fair EU elections
Short Description / inclusion criteria: EU cybersecurity exercise to evaluate and strengthen possible responses to potential cybersecurity incidents affecting the European elections

Title: Japan: EU and Japan hold fifth Dialogue in Brussels
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The EU and Japan discussed their respective cyber strategies, bilateral cooperational. They also exchanged on capacity building and the threat landscape. They agreed to continue the Dialogue on a regular basis
Institution: EEAS, EC3, EUROPOL, CERT-EU, Commission, ENISA

Title: Speech by Commissioner McGuinness at BEUC event on digital finance
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Concern around cyber attacks and cyber security in the finance sector

Title: Making further progress in the strategic partnership at 2023 EU – Canada Summit
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Agreement between Canada and the EU to work togheter in crucial areas such as AI and cyber security.

Title: Cyber Resilience Act: agreement with Council to boost digital product's security
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Agreement with council to strengthen the cybersecurity of new connected products.

Title: Keynote speech by President von der Leyen at the EDA Annual Conference 2023: Powering up European Defence
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Stresses that security is more interlinked than ever before.

Title: Switzerland: EU-Switzerland hold first structured Security and Defence Dialogue and mediation talks
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Agreement between the EU and Switzerland to hold the Dialogue on an annual basis

Title: "A European Defence for our Geopolitical Union": speech by President Charles Michel at the EDA annual conference
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Proposal for a European cyber force that would be a fundamental component of the European defence with offensive capabilities.

Title: EU Statement – UN General Assembly: Informal Consultations on the Summit of the Future Chapter 2 on International Peace and Security
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Stresses that a  global and secure cyberspace is only possbile if the implementation of the agreed framework for repsonsible state behavior is supported and if they improve coordination.

Title: Cyber-Fragen: Erklärung des Hohen Vertreters im Namen der Europäischen Union über den Schutz demokratischer Prozesse vor böswilligen Cyberaktivitäten
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The EU condemns malicious cyber activities with the goal of disrupting or manipulating democratic institutions and elections. They are ready to empose sanctions to prevent cyber attacks.

Title: Daily News 07 / 12 / 2023
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Agreement between the EU and USA to strengthen the transatlantic cooperation and to further enhance global cyber resilience by implementing cyber capacity building.

Title: Western Balkans: Press remarks by High Representative Josep Borell ahead of the EU-Western Balkans Summit
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Awareness raising concering the challenges like cyber attacks Western Balkan is facing as they align themselves with the Foreign and Security Policy of the EU.

Title: Daily News 14/12/2023
Short Description / inclusion criteria: EU invests more than 760 in digital transition and cybersecurity to enhance the EU's collective resilience against cyber threats.

Title: Cyber: EU and UK launch Cyber Dialogue
Short Description / inclusion criteria: EU and UK raising awareness on a changed threat landscape following the Russian invasion of Ukraine, at the first meeting of their cyber dialogue

Title: EU Statement - UN Open-Ended Working Group on ICT: Confidence - Building Measures
Short Description / inclusion criteria: The EU stresses that cyber confidence building measures are an essential tool in mitigating the risks of misperception and unintended escalation. The EU believes that CBMs are best implemented by regional organizations with the capacity and expertise.

Title: Cyber: Statement by the High Representative on behalf of the European Union, expressing solidarity with Australia on the impact of cyber-attacks against its health sector
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Statement signaling condemnation of cyber activities targeting essential operators, raising awareness on an increase of attacks on the healthcare sector and highlighting EU commitment to combat such attacks through joint diplomatic action

Title: Keynote speech on "Shaping the digital future of finance" by Commissioner McGuinness at Afore Annual Conference on Fintech and Regulation
linked CI: Ransomware attack Industrial and Commercial Bank of China
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Highlights cyber-security as a top priority, raises awareness on high number of cyber attacks and their impact in the financial sector

Title: Joint Statement by Commissioner for Internal Market Breton and United States Secretary of Homeland Security Mayorkas
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Joint statement with announcment of closer cooperation on cybersecurity between the US and the EU; awarenessraising on a proliferation of threats in cyberspace

Title: Defence: Statement on behalf of High Representative Josep Borrell at the EP debate on strengthening European Defence in a volatile geopolitical landscape
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Awareness raising on cyber defense capabilities being needed in the modern threat landscape facing the EU, signals awareness that the Russian invasion of Ukraine further changed the cyber landscape

Title: OSCE Permanent Council No.1465 Vienna, 14 March 2024; EU Statement on the Russian Federation’s ongoing aggression against Ukraine
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Condemns Russian cyber attacks and disinformation campaigns, signals the seriousness of this issue for the EU and insists on the ceasement of such actions agains the EU, the OSCE and a variety of states
Form: Press release/ Eu Statement Delegation to UN and OSCE

Title: Joint press release following the 9th Association Council meeting between the EU and Ukraine
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Raises awareness on EU strategic orientation in strengthening Ukrainian cybersecurity, such efforts being in line with NIS2 and other frameworks

Title: Cybersecurity Rapid Response for Albania, Montenegro and North Macedonia 2.0
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Support Package with 1.8 million Euros to support Albania, Montenegro and North Macedonia to fend off increasing levels of threats in the cyberspace.

Title: NÚKIB-AKCESK Cyber Security Exercise in Albania
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Capacity building in Albania seeking to enhance crisis communication between institutions thus strenghtening cyber resilience

Title: EU and Canada boost their strategic digital partnership to address new challenges
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Joint statement of Canada and the EU with the intention to collaborate on cybersecurity regulatory frameworks and standards, including information exchange as a first step; convening of a dialog to further decide on steps

Title: Vice-President Suica delivers a keynote speech via video message for 15th Regional Airports Conference and Exhibition “Regional Airports Navigating Change: Resilience, Sustainability, and Financial Viability", organized by ACI Europe
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Raises awareness on a need to increase cyber security due to recent surges in cyber attacks

Title: Moldova: Joint press statement following the third High-Level Political and Security Dialogue with the EU
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Joint statement following dialogue of Moldova and the EU to further intensify security cooperation including cybersecurity

Title: Cyber: Statement by the High Representative on behalf of the EU on continued malicious behaviour in cyberspace by the Russian Federation
linked CI: APT 28, Bundestag hack, German Social Democratic Party (SPD) cyber attack
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Signaling statement by the high representative, condemning russian behaviour in cyberspace and highlighting EU determination to deter and respond to malicious russian behaviour in cyberspace

Title: Commission reports on overall progress on the Security Union
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Raises awareness on a variety of sectors vulnerable to cyberattack whilst informing about policies undertaken to mitigate such attacks and increase cybersecurity

Title: OSCE Permanent Council 1473 Vienna, 16 May 2024: EU Statement on the Russian Federation’s malign activities and interference in the OSCE region
linked CI: APT 28, Bundestag hack, German Social Democratic Party (SPD) cyber attack
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Condemns Russian behavior in cyberspace, signals the seriousness of the situation for the EU and consequences of such actions, highlights how the OSCE can assist in promoting security in cyberspace, also raises awareness on russian behavior in cyberspace and such actions violation norms of responsible behavior in cyberspace
Form: Press release/ Eu Statement Delegation to UN and OSCE

Title: Cybersecurity: Council approves conclusions for a more cyber secure and resilient Union
Short Description / inclusion criteria: EU Council conclusion setting out action and a call on further clarification of roles in the cyber domain, further expresses the need for a multistakeholder approach; signaling. Raises awareness on an increased threat.

Title: Cybersecurity Training Program to Strengthen Cyber Capabilities in the Caribbean Region
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Capacity building in the Caribbean Region

Title: EU Statement - UN Security Council High-Level Open Debate: Maintenance of International Peace and Security - Addressing Evolving Threats in Cyberspace
linked CI: APT 28, Bundestag hack, German Social Democratic Party (SPD) cyber attack
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Calls for a stop of russian linked cyber espionage, signals concern over such activities and signals that such activities are contrary to responsible state behavior and international norms, raises awareness on the difficulties regarding attribution and cross-border impact of cyber attacks
Form: Press release/ EU Statement Delegation to UN

Title: Cyber-attacks: six persons added to EU sanctions list for malicious cyber activities against EU member states and Ukraine
linked CI: Callisto group, Armageddon hacker group, Conti, Trickbot, Wizard Spider, ViaSat/KA-SAT
Short Description / inclusion criteria: Sanctioning of 6 individuals, some of whom supported by the russian FSB, condemnation of malicious russian cyber activities, strengthening of cooperation with Ukraine, informs about the framework
